title: What is AR and VR technology in 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi There! Technology is changing. It is amazing how we are evolving in a shorter duration of time. The things that were assumed as impractical are now trending on the world. Who would have believed we could experience the natural environment simply by clicking a button on the smartphone sitting in the living room! Isn’t it amazing? What exactly is Augmented Reality? In simple words, Augmented Reality is the advance technology that adds an extra layer of digital information by expanding into our physical world. It does not create any new artificial environment to replace the real one with the virtual environment. Rather, it appears in direct view of the existing environment and also adds videos, sounds, and graphics to make it more interactive and visually appealing. Nowadays, AR, as Augmented Reality is fondly called, is widely used to improve the immersive viewing experience of the natural situations. With the help of advanced AR technologies such as object recognition, computer vision, the information about the surrounding real environment of the user becomes digital and interactive. You can view the real world situation with the computer generated superimposed images, thus changing the perception of reality. Augmented reality innovation can in any case go much further as the adoption rates gradually tick up and the figuring capacities of our mobile phones keep on improving quite a long time after year. The manner in which we connect with amusements on our smartphones will never be a similar when full AR appropriation goes to the cutting edge of our aggregate application stores. What is Virtual Reality? Unlike some other field specific technological developments, VR has the potential to influence multiple realms of extension such as gaming, family, etc. Virtual reality can transpose the user. It brings us to some other place. Using goggles or closed visors, VR blocks out the room and puts our presence somewhere else. Some of the brilliant examples of VR are Samsung Gear VR, Oculus Rift and Google Cardboard. If you have not tried any of these, be ready to get blown away by its amazingness. What it usually does is, it expands our senses with experiences within after we put a VR headset over our eyes. You can even find yourself on top of Mount Everest. The immersion is very artistic, even some users have reported feelings of movements as they ride a rollercoaster within the virtual environment. VR is mostly immersive. With virtual reality, you can swim with the sharks. VR has the potential to turn into an entertainment activity, from movies, leisure activities to gaming and great story telling. Virtual reality is gaining traction and is more relevant in our current market scenario than ever before. Hope it answers your question.

In 2020, augmented reality (AR) and virutal reality (VR) are no longer just a concept in your local news headline. For example, in the digital age of customization and personal shopping, the retail and eCommerce industries are depending on AR/VR to boost their sales and stick out in competitive markets. What was once seen as a fantasy in popular Sci-fi films, is now a real technology adopted by the biggest companies in a variety of industries worldwide. When shopping, AR applications allow clients to “try before you buy,” a feature that helps customers asses whether or not to purchase an article of clothing; when designing a building, VR helps architects, construction crews and developers to envision what a proposed sketch would look like.
